channel.title: Design on Senkbeil
channel.description: Recent content in Design on Senkbeil

item.title: Design to Embrace Change
item.description: So, I’ve been reading Practical Object-Oriented Design in Ruby while also watching the VT football game today, something I am beginning to regret. During my freshman and sophomore years at Virginia Tech, I was introduced to quite a few concepts regarding Object Oriented Programming. Mostly, these related to simplistic encapsulation of data - writing setters and getters for any and all variables - as well as using inheritance mixed with interfaces.
